intro: Leontodon protheiformis subsp. hastilis, commonly known as the hairy leontodon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that are typically arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
